title: Video shows terrifying landing at Madeira Airport in Funchal
text:
56 shares 18

This nerve-wracking footage reveals a pilot’s struggle to land a passenger jet as it is battered by a fierce crosswind at one of the ‘scariest’ airports in the world.
The video shows an Air Berlin plane rocking from side to side, and appearing to be blown off course as it approaches the runway in Funchal, on the Portuguese island of Madeira.
With high winds posing an immense challenge for the flight crew, the jet filled with holidaymakers bounces off the runway after its landing gear touches down, and then completes the safe landing.
Crazy landing as plane combats strong wind in Madeira The video shows an Air Berlin plane rocking from side to side, and appearing to shift off course at times
Given its turbulent winds, Funchal is frequently included in lists of the 'scariest' runways in the world
The footage shows the difficulties pilots face on a regular basis at Funchal, and the skills required to make a safe landing in challenging weather conditions.
An Air Berlin spokesperson told MailOnline Travel: 'Our pilots get a specific, very extensive training for landings at Madeira Airport.'

Part of the runway is on stilts after an extension was built in 2000.
An Air Berlin spokesperson said its pilots 'get a specific, very extensive training for landings at Madeira'
The jet filled with holidaymakers bounces after its landing gear touches down and completes the safe landing
Earlier this year, British Airways released footage that shows a pilot’s-eye view of a landing at Madeira Airport using cameras mounted inside the cockpit.
In that video, the BA captain had to contend with high winds and were unable to rely on the plane’s instruments as they landed at Madeira Airport, nestled between the Atlantic Ocean and a hill dotted with homes.
The landing is so difficult that BA and Airbus have developed a bespoke plan that has been approved by authorities, which includes using banana sheds as a waypoint to navigate the ‘tricky terrain’ to the left of the runway.
